task_study.Description: Participants viewed words and provided Yes/No responses to either a shoebox or manmade semantic judgment. Participants received either an informative cue (red or blue square) or uninformative/uncued cue (fixation cross remained) about the judgment to make. The informed and uninformed/uncued conditions were presented in a blocked format. Note, uninformative trials/files/instructions/descriptions should be conceptually considered to be uncued/no cue trials.

study_cb.Description: Whether participant was assigned to counterbalance A (blocks: informative-uninformative-uninformative-informative) or B (blocks: uninformative-informative-informative-uninformative).

list.Description: Stimuli list assignment for the participant; between lists 1-4

phase_name.Description: Cue block condition and study list: Informed(1 or 2)_study(1-4) or Uninformed(1-2)_study(1-4)

study_phase.Description: Block condition: Informed1, Informed2, Uninformed1, Uninformed2

manmade.Description: Whether subjective correct response for manmade judgment is Y or N

shoebox.Description: Whether subjective correct response for shoebox judgment is Y or N

nletters.Description: Word length; length of word between 4-8 letters

old_new.Description: Memory type for the word: old (presented at study) or new

study_judgment.Description: Whether the semantic judgment for the trial is shoebox or manmade

cue_condition.Description: Whether the trial is informed, uninformed, or new

cue_color.Description: Whether the color of the cue is cyan (for manmade), red (for shoebox), or n/a (for uninformed trials)

box_color.Description: Whether the color of box around the word is white, cyan, or red

show_cue.Description: Whether a cue was shown for this trial: 1 (yes); 0 (no)

study_resp_key.Description: Whether participants judgment response is: j (yes), k (no), or na (no responses)

study_resp.Description: Participants study judgment responses: yes (1), no (2); (-99 for no responses)

study_rt.Description: Participants study judgment response reaction times; (NaN for no responses)

study_good_trial.Description: Numerically mark if trial is good (1) or bad (0) based on if participants made a study judgment response; see preregistration for more information

task_test.Description: Participants completed an incidental recognition test. Participants made confidence ratings (1[sure new]-6[sure old] and source memory response (4-shoebox, 5-manmade,6-dont know). Note, uninformative trials/files/instructions/descriptions should be conceptually considered to be uncued/no cue trials.

test_cb.Description: Stimulus file based on counterbalance; either test1,test2,test3, or test4

item_resp.Description: Participants item memory response: 1 (sure new); -6 (sure old); n/a (no responses)

item_rt.Description: Participants item memory reaction times (-99 if no responses)

item_acc.Description: Participants item memory accuracy: 1(correct), 0 (incorrect); (-99 if no responses)

old_new_resp.Description: Participants item memory response: 1-old (4-6), 0-new (1-3); (-99 if no responses)

sm_resp.Description: Participants source memory response: 4-shoebox, 5-manmade, 6-dont know; (-99 if no responses)

sm_rt.Description: Participants source memory response reaction times (-99 if no responses)

sm_acc.Description: Participants source memory accuracy: 1 (correct), 0 (incorrect); (-99 if no responses)

test_good_trial.Description: Whether participant responded in alloted time: 1(responded, good trial); 0(did not respond, not good trial)

study_judgement_correct_resp.Description: Participants study judgment responses: yes (1), no (2); (-99 for no responses)

good_trial.Description: Numerically mark if trial is good (1) or bad (0) based on if participants test performance; see prereg for more information
